0.name: Entrance to the Swamps of Amnos
desc: "   Before you stretches an enormous swamp.  The trees tower over you, but
are far enough apart to let in the sun.  The beams of sunlight cheer you, and
give you the courage to follow the path to the east.

1.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You are following an east-west path.  The cobbles keep your feet dry, but
they seem to be very dirty here.  Mud has been tracked onto the path from
the south.

2.name: Slogging through the mud.
desc: "   YUCK!  The mud is getting in your boots.  You can feel the mud squish
between your toes.  Now you wish you had another route into the swamps.
The mud seems to get a little shallower to the south.

3.name: Still slogging through the mud.
desc: "   Shlurp.  Shlurp.  Its very hard work pulling your feet out of the mud at
each step, but the mud is getting slightly shallower.  There seems to be a
rise in the land to the east, a safe haven from all this mud.

4.name: On safe footing.
desc: "  Finally! Out of that awful mud.  The swamp seems much more pleasant away
from the mud.  Everything seems peaceful and quiet.  You can contiune
following the rise to the east.  To the south looks like one big mud puddle.

5.name: Mud puddle.
desc: "   You are surrounded by mud everywhere.  As you stand here you slowly sink
up to your thighs in mud.  It's going to take a lot of work to get out of
of this puddle.  Maybe you should avoid mud puddles from now on.

6.name: On safe footing.
desc: "   You find yourself following a rise in the swamp that goes to the west
and the south.  In this peaceful area you can hear the wind rustling the
branches, making a beautiful song.

7.name: In a glade.
desc: "   The rise into the swap ends in a sparking glade.  The sun shines down on
the grass, turning the dew into rainbows.  Swarms of butterflies dance
around the flowers, drinking their nectar.  As you approach the butterflies
scatter and fly up into the trees.

8.name: In a glade.
desc: "   You wander in the glade, lost in thoughts of dew and rainbows.  A butterfly
flitters down to your nose and lands there.  It looks deep into your eyes
then takes off to flutter amoung the trees.

9.name: In a glade.
desc: "   You wander in the glade, entranced with the sparkle of the dew and the
sunbeams shining through the trees.  The flowers bloom in a rainbow of
colors.  Every flower is surrounded with butterflies.

10.name: Edge of glade.
desc: "   You are at the edge of the sparkling glade, and you've had just about
enough of sunbeams and flowers.  You're an adventurer and killing butterflies
is for children.  The swamps and the mud are for real aventurers.

11.name: Back in the swamps.
desc: "   Squish!  Ah it's good to be back in the mud.  Squish!  The trees here cut
out the sunlight.  There is no wind in the trees and everything seems
strangely quiet.  As you strain your ears you can hear a faint clacking
sound to the east, as if someone were hitting sticks together.

12.name: In the mud.
desc: "   Squish!  As your toes go numb from the swamp mud, you notice the clicking
sound here is very loud.  You are surprised to see two large walking sticks
fighting in the trees above you.  As you turn your face up to get a better
view the leg of one walking stick falls down in front of your eyes.  You turn
your eyes quickly back to your path.

13.name: Walking stick hatchery.
desc: "   You see before you an area filled with eggs and tiny walking sticks
hatching out.  Baby walking sticks scurry back and fourth, stopping now
and then to have small fights amongst themselves.  You see some eating
away at the leaves on the trees, which are by now almost defoliated.

14.name: In the mud.
desc: "   Squish!  The trees loom silently above you blocking out most of the
sunlight.  As the clacking sound to the west starts to fade, you can hear
an odd rustling sound to the east.

15.name: In the mud.
desc: "   A line of army ants travels quickly up in the branches.  They seem to be
carrying little bits of something to the south, but you can't quite make
out what they have.  Luckily most of them seem to be well up in the trees,
for they look quite mean.

16.name: Near a corpse.
desc: "   You tromp through the mud following the line of ants to see where they
come from.  You watch them up in the branches and notice they come down off
one of the trees to your right.  As you look down you see them feeding off
an old corpse.  To the north you see some nasty thorns.

17.name: Nest of army ants.
desc: "   The nest of army ants hangs from the branch of a tree.  It is made up of
leaves all bound together.  You see many ants holding bits of flesh entering
the nest and coming back out for a new load.  The queen ant seems quite
well protected from intruders.

18.name: Walking stick playground.
desc: "   Older walking sticks are running around here playing in mock fights.
Their antics seem almost comical as they each try to get the upper hand.
One of them falls from the tree in its play and lands in a puddle in
the mud.  As it struggles to get out you laugh.

19.name: Near a stagnant pool.
desc: "   As you tromp through the mud you find yourself next to a stagnant pool.
The water doesn't appear to be too deep, but with swamps you can never tell.
A most offensive odor wafts through the air from the pool, and a faint
humming sound can be heard.

20.name: In a stagnant pool.
desc: "   You are standing in water up to you knees.  The stench from the water is
overwhelming.  Insects buzz over the water, swarms of mosquitoes and
dragonflies.  A cloud of mosquitoes hover just over your head.  Did you
remember to bring your repellent with you?

21.name: In a stagnant pool.
desc: "   The water now comes up to your waist.  If it gets any deeper you'll
have to start swimming.  The stench has become so bad it makes you dizzy.
Bits of rotting leaves float in the water making a landing pad for a
hovering dragonfly.

22.name: In a stagnant pool.
desc: "   The pool has become too deep to walk through.  It has turned strangely
calm.  What has happened to all the insects?  Maybe the stench drove them
off.  Small ripples come from the water.
"   The ripples attract your attention, and you look down into the water.
You can see a monster faintly down in the depths.

23.name: In a stagnant pool.
desc: "   You are standing in water up to your knees.  The stench is terrible and
seems to get worse to the north.  The dragonflies flitter about chasing
the mosquitoes.

24.name: In a stagnant pool.
desc: "   The water here is shallow.  It barely gets in your boots.  Little water
skimmers zip back and forth among the reeds.  Their movement causes small
ripples on the surface of the pool.  You breath easier as the stench seems
to dissipate.

25.name: In a stagnant pool.
desc: "   You splash through the pool sending water everywhere.  The water skippers
zip to the east scared of you noisy movement.  If only the mosquitoes would
leave you alone.  They constantly buzz in your ears.

26.name: Near a stagnant pool.
desc: "  You follow the edge to a pool of water.  The water doesn't look too deep
wo walk through, but the clouds of mosquitoes hovering over it is a little
discouraging.  As you look around bright flashes of light catch your eye
to the south, appearing from a small hole in the leaves.

27.name: In a deep pool.
desc: "   You find yourself deep in the water.  The muck is so thick it is hard to see
anything.  You get a small bit of water in your mouth and it is the most foul and
awful stuff you have ever tasted.

28.name: In the beetle's home.
desc: "   You stand in the first room of the beetle's home.  Bright flashes of light
are everywhere.  The cuticle of the iridescent beetles seems to give off a
light or maybe it's just a reflection of the sun's rays.  Wherever it comes
from the light is blinding making them very hard to see.

29.name: In the beetle's home.
desc: "   The glare here seems to be much better.  The smaller bettles don't seem to
give off as much light as the larger ones.  You can see beetles scurrying
back and forth in their home.  They seem to be enlarging their home with
bits of mud and stick.

30.name: The end of the beetle's home.
desc: "   You are in the last room of the beetles home.  It is much larger then the
other two rooms, and it needs to be.  This is the home of the ancient beetle.
A little sleeping pad is here for it to rest on.  There seems to be a small
hole in the wall to the north.

31.name: In the brush.
desc: "   You squeeze into a narrow space between some bushes.  It is very cramped
and the branches seem to tear at your clothing.  You see a small opening to
the west, anything to get out of the bushes.

32.name: A silence in the swamp.
desc: "   The mud here seems especially vile.  It seems to be taking on a life of
its own, grabbing your feet at every step.  You listen carefully and hear
nothing.  Not the rustle of a leaf or a whisper of an insects wings.  A
shiver runs down your spine and you're not sure you wish to go on.

33.name: A silence in the swamp.
desc: "    As you try to pull your feet from the mud, you become more concerned with
the silence.  Nothing makes a noise except your steps in the mud and even
they are oddly hushed.  You resist an urge to flee this place, but you
question the wisdom of going forward.

34.name: The sound of slithering.
desc: "   You find yourself in the home of a large python.  He hangs from the
branches of the tree above you.  You wish with all your might you had not
wandered in here.  Maybe you can flee before he has you for breakfast.

35.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You are still following the east-west path through the swamps.  The path
does a good job of keeping your feet dry.  A winding trail that leads off
to the north looks a little bit wet.

36.name: A wet trail.
desc: "   The swamp here is very open, with no trees to block the sun.  You splash
down the twisting path, whistling as you go.  There is a huge stone with
writing on it coming out of the mud.
"   The stone is covered with graffiti.  In bright red letters you see the
words, Twilight was here.  Underneath and a little faded you can make out
the words, dont follow this path I had a fr.....got lost....beware.

37.name: A wet trail.
desc: "   As you follow the winding trail through the muck, the sun warms your head.
A gentle breeze blows by keeping the mosquitoes away.  You make a game jumping
from hillock to hillock.

38.name: A wet trail.
desc: "   The trail you follow winds its way to the south now.  The water gets a
little deeper and you have to leap farther and farther to keep dry. You jump
too far, slip and get wet head to toe.  You shake yourself off swearing at
the swamp.

39.name: A wet trail.
desc: "   The path seems easier to travel here.  Some kind soul put down logs to
walk on so you won't get wet.  The path seems go into an area of brush to
the east.  It looks as though you can get in but you might not able to get
back again.

40.name: Lost in the brush.
desc: "   You find yourself lost in the brush.  You desperately look around you
but you see no way back to the winding path.  Each direction seems to be
the same as the other.  You can push your way through in any direction, but
none seems better than the others.

41.name: Lost in the brush.
desc: "   You find yourself lost in the brush.  You desperately look around you
but you see no way back to the winding path.  Each direction seems to be
the same as the other.  You can push your way through in any direction, but
none seems better than the others.

49.name: Lost in the brush.
desc: "   You find yourself lost in the brush.  You desperately look around you,
but you see no way back to the winding path.  You start to get cold and
can't figure out why, but it seems to be colder to the south.

50.name: Lost in the brush.
desc: "   You find yourself lost in the brush.  You desperately look around you

desc: "   You find yourself lost in the brush.  You desperately look around you
but you see no way back to the winding path.  Each direction seems to be
the same as the other.  You can push your way through in any direction, but
none seems better than the others.

64.name: Fairie's frost.
desc: "   All around you the bushes are covered with frost.  A mad little fairy
seems to be zooming about, touching her wand to each plant.  As she
touches one all the leaves become frosted up.  After a while the frost melts.
So she ends up doing it over and over again.

65.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You are following the main path through the swamps.  It continues on to the
east.  You see a small branch in the path going to the south, leading toward
a large camp.

66.name: Large camp.
desc: "   You stand on a wooden platform above the swamp.  Many people are here
milling about and trying to set up camp.  A few of them seem not to belong
here.  They are tourists and are being helped by capable guides.  You can
see a large tent to the west sporting a sign with 'Store' written on it.
To the east is a small but sharp looking tent.

67.name: Camp store.
desc: "   You duck inside the canvas tent.  Inside is slightly dark but you still
can make out three rows of shelves, covered with assorted provisions.  The
proprietor of the store looks at you suspiciously. Then he says, "Go away
I'm closed to the likes of you."  There is a sign here.

extra.desc: "   Try our new mosquito repellent, only 3 coins a bottle.

68.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You are following the main path through the swamps.  It continues to the
east as far as your eyes can see.  The path is no longer cobblestoned, and you
can tell that no carts can be pulled down here.  However, there are rocks
that have been thrown on the path to keep your feet dry.

69.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You follow a long path in the swamps.  As you wander along you start to
look at the birds along the way.  Why look it's a snowy egret.  You'll have to
put that one in your bird watching book.
"   You see a small white heron that has a narrow black bill.  It must be the
breeding season for it because it has beautiful plumes all along its back.

70.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   The rocky path goes deep into the swamp, barely keeping you above the
water. The trees loom over you, dripping with moss. You get to a small
rise. The path below you is now spongy with bright green moss.

71.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You hop along the stony path looking for birds.  You gasp as you spy a
rare Cory's Least Bittern running quickly through the reeds.  What a pretty
little bird.
"   You look at the little bittern.  It runs with an amazing speed over the lily
pads.  It has a long beak and reddish feathers.  As it runs from sight you can
still hear its coo-coo-coo.

72.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You follow the main path through the swamps.  You hear in the distance the
grunts of cormorant.  You look up into one of the trees and can see it in
its nest of sticks.
"   The bird is all black with an orange throut pouch.  It sits up in its nest
surveying its surroundings.

73.name: Turn in the path.
desc: "   The path you follow takes a turn to the north.  If you continued to the
east you would run into a large patch of brambles.  Their thorns do not look
too appealing.
"   The thorns poke out from a patch of multiflora roses.  The white flowers
look lovely and the scent is wonderful, but the thorns look like they could
do a lot of damage if you pushed your way through.

74.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   The path branches off here.  One path leads to the east and one to the north.
Either path seems just as inviting.  As you strain your eyes to the north
you can just make out a few birds.  You see nothing to the east.

75.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You follow the path through the swamps.  You are surprised to see the
snake-like head of an Anhinga sticking up through the swamp water.  As
it catches a fish, it flips the fish up in the air.  The fish comes down
headfirst right into the bird's beak.
"   The Anhinga is an graceful bird with with a long thin neck.  Most of the bird si
submerged in the water.  Just its neck sticks out.
"   The Anhinga is a graceful bird with a long thin neck.  Most of the bird
is submurged in the water.  Just its neck sticks out.

76.name: At an intersection in the swamps.
desc: "   You are at an intersection where three paths come together.  The path to
the north takes you deeper into the swamp.  You can hear the caws and grunts
and coos of many birds but you can't seem to see any of them.
"   Weren't you just told you didn't see any birds? Quit trying to look at
nonexistant birds.

77.name: On a path in the swamps
desc: "   You follow the path in the swamp skipping from rock to rock as you go.
You can see a rickety old bridge to the east with a large reptillian
creature standing on it.  The path continues to the north.

78.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You follow the path through the swamps.  It does not seem as well kept up
as before.  Maybe the reptillian creatures to the east keep the path in repair
and don't like going here.  Or maybe it's traveled on so much the stones have
sunk into the mud.  Whatever the reason you are going to have to be careful
on this slippery path.

79.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   Well, it looks like a long ways to the next point for interest.  Maybe you
should start putting more birds in your birding journal.  No birds of interest
seem to live here but maybe farther on?

80.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You look madly around for more birds.  You think you see a Yellow-crowned
Night Heron off the the north a little.  You quicken your pace so you can see
past the next bush, but in your haste you trip over a rock sticking up.  Ick!
Now your pants are all muddy and your bottom is sore.  Not only that but you
made so much noise you scared off the birds.

81.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You tromp along the path swearing at your clumsiness.  You peer to the
north hoping to find something interesting for an adventurer, but all you see
is the path going north deeper into the swamp.

82.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   As you follow the north-south path,  it seems to be getting colder.  You
find a large very cold bush to the west.  You try to push through it but
you don't seem to be strong enough.  You untangle the sticks from your hair
and travel on.

83.name: A turn in the path.
desc: "   The path makes a wide turn to the south and east.  The brush seems to be
thinning out but the puddles are getting deeper and deeper.  You step carefully
around them.

84.name: Going over a bridge.
desc: "   You are standing on a very rickety bridge.  A large reptillian creature
looms over you wanting to know your business with his people.  He shouts
"Evil ones are not welcome, go back to where you come from before I have
to kill you."  He then turns away and begins mumbling to himself.

85.name: On a lake.
desc: "   You are on a deep lake.  The surface of the water seems to be slate gray,
and very uninviting.  There are reptillian creatures paddling about in
small rowboats.  They seem to be catching mottled brown fish in their nets.
The fish look very bony and unappetizing.

86.name: On a lake.
desc: "   The lake gets a bit shallower here.  The reptillian creatures seem grim
and determined to haul up the most disgusting looking fish imaginable.  Why
would anyone want to eat those fish. Yuck!

87.name: Near the shore of a lake.
desc: "   There are a couple of rowboats here in very shabby condition.  These
creatures don't seem to have much respect for their things.  Bits of
fishbone and net are scattered all over the ground.

88.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   You wonder where the reptiles live.  Maybe they stay in their boats all night
long, but you doubt it.  So off you trudge into a forest in the swamp.  The
trees hang down low and seem to be watching you with every step you make.

89.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   You think you hear a noise and jump in surprise.  You look all around you
but you see nothing but thick forest.  As you try to listen closer you think
you hear laughter off to the east.

90.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   The branches of the trees hang low to the ground.  It's hard work pushing
your way through.  Bits of needle and branch get stuck in your hair, as the
branches seem to grab at you.

91.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   You are sure you can hear evil laughter all around you.  The swamps seem
to close in and the mud pulls at your feet to keep you here.  You can see exits
in all directions.  Maybe you should take one now.

92.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   The sound of laughter fills the air.  You look everywhere to see where
it could be coming from but you can't figure it out.  It seems the trees
themselves are laughing at you.  The chill laughter makes a shiver run
down your spine.

93.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   The muck seems to be getting deeper here.  It oozes over the tops of your
boots.  As you pant from the exertion, you get a good whiff of the smell of
the swamp.  Gag!

94.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   You see huddled in the muck a poor little reptile girl.  She is crying
miserably.  When you ask her why she says "I like being a reptile, but I'm
not supposed to."  You try in vain to get her to talk to you again but can't.

95.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   The trees close in around you with a life of their own.  Branches scrape at
your face and tear small rips in your clothing.  They are too thick to the
north and the east but if you hurry, maybe you push out to the south or west.

96.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   You continue to push your way through the cypress trees.  Their needles
poke at you with each step you take.  You get the idea that they don't really
want you here.  As you look for a good way out, you see that any direction is
as good as the other.

97.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   Here is where the laughter is coming from.  Four reptillian children play
throwing balls of mud at one another.  They seem to be having a grand old
time, unlike their parents.  Then one large hag-like reptile swoops down and
scolds them.  "You know better than to play like this.  We must be quiet and
good to prove to the Earth Mother that we have reformed.  You don't want to
be reptiles all your life, do you?

98.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   You hear the sound of hushed laughter to the north.  The trees seem to be
dripping on you.  The drips run off your hair and down your back.  Your back
starts to itch like crazy, but you can't seem to reach it.

99.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   The smell of decay and cypress start to make you sick.  Maybe now is a
good time to find somewhere else to go.  You miss the sun warming your armor,
and you would love to find a good spot to dry out your feet.

100.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   The cypresses grow very closely together.  Some even seem to be intertwinned
with one another.  You are sure that trees don't grow this way naturally.  What
could have caused their misshapen apperance?

101.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   You tire of stomping through the mud.  You imagined much more excitement
when you set off for your journey.  You sit down to rest leaning against a
tree trunk.  You gaze up into the branches of the tree and think you see
something up there, but you can't be sure.

102.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   One of the trees here seems to have a slightly different kind of bark.  It
seems smoother and greener than the other trees.  You detect faint scratch
marks on the bark.

103.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   This must be the most dismal part of the swamp you have seen so far.  Just
enough of the light gets through to see by, but it's dark enough that the
colors of the trees have washed out.  Even the trees themselves look tired
and worn out.

104.name: Trudging through the muck.
desc: "   Before you is a strange sight.  There is a reptillian mage chanting to a
small tree.  As he chants the tree twists and grows.  This continues for
quite some time, until the mage collapses into the mud, exhausted.

105.name: Teacher's lounge.
desc: "   You find yourself in the teacher's lounge.  You see one teacher with his
feet up on a desk smoking.  When you walk in he gasps and quickly puts out
his cigarette.  He blushes and looks away.

106.name: Classroom.
desc: "   Little reptile children sit on the floor in rows.  Each one has a slate
and chalk in their lap.  The teacher tells them all about King Gilfor and
how he started the great war with the elves, and about the three great
weapons that were forged.  When the teacher sees you coming in he yells at
you to leave.

107.name: Hallway.
desc: "   The graceful curve of the hallway ends in a door to the east.  You can
hear the chitter of children and the screech of chalk against a blackboard.
A small sign hangs from the doorknob.

extra.desc: "   Please do not disturb.  Class in progress.

108.name: Hallway.
desc: "   You follow the bending in the hallway.  The branches of the floor follow
the curve of the hall beautifully.  They form a graceful sweep to the north-
west.

109.name: Hallway.
desc: "   You walk down the grimy hall carefully to avoid kicking up dust into the
air.  You marvel at the construction of the hall and the walls.  Underneath
the dirt they are the most beautiful things you have seen.

110.name: Bedroom.
desc: "   You enter a bare bedroom.  Someone is curled up in the corner sleeping.
It looks very uncomfortable to sleep on the bare floor.  You wonder if the kids
were having a mud fight in here.  Mud streaks the branches of the walls.

111.name: Hallway.
desc: "   You stand in a grungy hall with doors to either side of you.  The hall
continues on the the north, getting dirtier as you travel.  As you walk along
your boots kick up clouds of dust making you cough.

112.name: Bedroom.
desc: "  As you enter you trip over the mess on the floor.  Ick , someones dirty
socks have been left here.  You see one small mattress in the corner and
many little beds made of pine needles.

113.name: Bedroom.
desc: "   It looks like you are in the bedroom to several of the reptiles.  Their
clothes are scattered all over the floor.  It looks like they make nests of
them to sleep in.

114.name: In a large room.
desc: "   You stand in a very large room.  You look with awe on the magically built
village made of trees, and you are saddened that it has fallen into such a
state of disrepair.  You feel a sudden urge to scrub the floors.  There is
a small store to the west.

115.name: Small store.
desc: "   There is an ugly looking reptile staring at you from behind a counter.
He looks very old and wrinkled.  All around the shop are piles of rotting
fish and vials carelessly thrown about.

116.name: In a large room.
desc: "   You find yourself in a very large room.  Your first thought is how beautiful
the room is.  It is formed from the tree itself.  The branches are very close
together and flat forming a very stable floor.  The walls are made of needles
and branches from the cypresses.  As you take a second look you notice that
it is also very ugly.  Trash is scattered all over the floor and dirt and dust
streaks the walls.

117.name: In a large room.
desc: "   You are in a very large room formed entirely out of living tree.  You marvel
at the magic it would take to build this.  To the west is a door made out of
very dense branches.  A sign hangs over the door.

118.name: In a large room.
desc: "   You stand in a very large room.  The room continues to the north and west.
To the south and east are very dingy hallways.  The branches of the trees
grow very thickly overhead forming a watertight ceiling.

119.name: Hallway.
desc: "   You stand in a dreary hallway.  To the east lies a very dismal church.
You can hear the sound of chanting past the door.  The sound grates on you.
Over the door hangs a sign.
"   The sign is crudely carved from a piece of cypress.  It reads, "Leave your
sins behind as you enter the sacred church of the Earth Mother.

120.name: Hallway.
desc: "   You walk down a very grimy hallway.  You are sure it hasn't been cleaned
in years.  Bits of hair and bone and dust cover the floor.  The wall is
covered in dirty handprints.

121.name: Llendolwir's bedroom.
desc: "   You are in a very tiny bedroom.  There is no real mattress on the floor,
just boughs of cypress strewn about.  It looks very uncomfortable.  There
is a cracked mirror on the wall and a small comb made of bone.

122.name: In the choir.
desc: "   You stand at the edge of the choir.  They seem to be chanting in croaks.
The sound seems very silly to you, and you have trouble stifling your laughter.
Reptiles definitely don't belong in a singing group.

123.name: In the choir.
desc: "   As you travel through the choir, you disrupt the singing.  What was once
a quiet croaking sound turns into a loud croaks and gasps.  The choir leader
withers you with his stare.

124.name: In a church.
desc: "   You stand at the back of the church.  In front of you are pews.  Not many
sit in the pews, and you don't blame them.  The priest talks in a flat mono-
tone that lulls you to sleep.

125.name: At the alter.
desc: "   The priest's glare tells you that you should not be standing here.  The
priest drones on and on with his sermon.  It seems interminable.  His voice
threatens to put you to sleep.

126.name: In a church.
desc: "   You are in the middle of the pews.  There are songbooks in the back of each
pew.  You take one out and see that it's written in an ancient elven tongue.
You shudder to imagine the beautiful elven songs on the lips of these
reptiles.

127.name: In a church.
desc: "   You are in the front row of pews.  You can hear the priest drone on and on.
"We must atone for the sins of our forefathers.  Our forefathers hurt the
Earth Mother with our greed.  We must cast off our greed.  Own nothing of
true value, covet nothing of ......

128.name: Meditation room.
desc: "   The meditation room fills with the smoke of incense.  The smoke burns at
your eyes.  Through the smoke you can see three women quietly sitting in
the middle of the room.

129.name: In an alcove in the museum.
desc: "   Before you hangs a beautiful portrait.  The artwork itself is exquisite,
but the face is even more breathtaking.  It is a portrait of the most
handsome elf you have ever seen.  There is a small label on the portrait.
Below the portrait is a crown.

extra.desc: "   King Llendlowir, may his reign last forever.

desc: "   The crown sits on a red velvet pillow.  It is wrought of gold and platinum
twined together.  Each point is adorned with a five carat emerald.  The
largest emerald is on the front and sparkles even in the gloom.

130.name: In a hall in the museum.
desc: "   You walk down a narrow hallway.  Your shoulders brush against the walls
as you go.  You have to duck your head so you don't bump it on the ceiling.
You are starting to feel very claustrophobic.

131.name: In a museum.
desc: "   There is a display case on the wall. Inside is a beautiful wizard's robe.
shimmering in the light.  There are runes embroidered on the robe in silver
thread.  A brass label is below the display case.
"   This robe was worn by Llidenowin,  the greatest mage of his time and the
most dispised of them all.  The spell he cast destroyed us and cursed
himself for all eternity.
"   The silver thread of the runes shimmer as you try to read them.  It gives
you a spliting headache.  They seem to shift and change with every passing
moment.  You turn away to rest your eyes.

132.name: In a museum.
desc: "   A display case stands in the middle of the room.  It holds a most remarkable
looking horn and was probably meant to call warriors to battle.  A brass label
is on the display case.
"   This horn has called our people to battle for thousands of years.  May it
never be blown again.
"   The horn must come from an unusual animal.  It is huge, two feet long, and
shines brightly in the light.  It twists in spirals of green and blue.  You
wonder what kind of animal would grow a horn like that.

133.name: In the museum.
desc: "   You stand in the entrance to the Museum of Remembrance.  You are shocked to
see that everything is clean.  No mud on the walls.  No dust to kick up.  For
a group of slovenly reptiles they keep this place in perfect repair.  It
must be very important to them.

134.name: In a museum.
desc: "   The display case before you seems to hold a broken hammer.  It is the
largest hammer you have ever seen.  It would take a very strong person
even to lift, much less wield it.  There is a label on the display case.
"   The hammer seems to be made of steel and very heavy.  It looks broken but
you think you might be able to get it fixed.  It is covered in dried blood.
"   This hammer is one of the three great weapons forged by the dwarves to
escalate the war.  It was carried by Gilfor's son into battle.  May it
never again be used in battle.

135.name: In the museum.
desc: "   In your tour through the museum you see a portrait of a dwarf.  The dwarf
wears a simple silver circlet on his brow.  A small brass label is affixed to
the picture.
"   The portrait shows a stout dwarf.  His brown eyes seem to follow you as you
move.  The portrait is framed in wood.
"   King Gilfor of the dwarves.  He started the Great War and now he lives
forever in agony.

136.name: In the museum.
desc: "   You stand before a display case.  Inside is the largest diamond you have
ever seen in your life.  It glitters in the light and seems to call out to
you.  Greed wells up in your heart and you feel you must possess it.  There
is a small brass label attached to the case.
"   We must banish greed from our race.  Greed was the cause of our downfall
and the Earth Mother will not let us rise again until we have cleansed
our souls of it.
"   You gaze into the depths of the diamond.  It seems to draw you in to
itself.  You try to pull yourself away but greed overwhelms you and you
search for a way into the case.

138.name: Climbing a tree.
desc: "   Even though the tree bark is very smooth it is easy to climb.  Convenient
branches stick out forming a ladder.  The branches grow very thick above
you, but upon poking around, you find a small hole to climb through.

139.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   Walking down the east-west path, you almost trip over a nest filled with
eggs.  The nest is made of grass and looks somewhat like a cup.  There are
four bluish green eggs with small brown blotches on it.  As you lean over
the nest, a very angry swamp sparrow dives down at you.

140.name: Faint path.
desc: "   As you push through the bushes you see a faint path on the ground.
Someone must go this way.  You can see the faint outline of a footprint.
The footprint looks reptillian.

141.name: Faint path.
desc: "   The path continues off to the east and west.  Not many have come here
but you see a set of footprints heading to the east.  You can follow the
the tracks.  The foot seems to have claws on the end, and strangely enough
only three toes.

142.name: Faint path.
desc: "   You stand at the end of a faint path.  It ends at the entrance to a small
cottage.  The cottage is whitewashed and has baby blue curtains in the
window.  You open the gate and walk up to the door.

143.name: Hermit's cottage.
desc: "   You stand in a quaint little cottage.  A woodstove stands in the corner
with tea bubbling away on top.  The curtains have lace trim on the bottom.
You hear a sound and look behind a table.  You see a strange old reptile
crying huddled on the floor.
"   You stare at the man and he looks at you and says, "I was once a great mage.
I could cast spells you could never attempt.  I should not be hiding here in
disgrace.  Help me please."  He grabs you shirt to keep you from leaving,
but you shrug him off easily.  Madmen can be so distasteful at times.
"   You stare at the man and he looks at you and says, "I was once a great mage
I could cast spells you could never attempt.  I should not be hiding in
disgrace like this.  Help me please."  He grabs your shirt to keep you here,
but you shrug him off easily.  Madmen can be so distasteful at times.

144.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   The swamp starts to open up as the water gets deeper.  There are a few large
trees that have drowned.  Their bare branches form a stark outline against the
sky.  To the east you see a flock of cormorants drying their wings in the sun.

145.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   The flock of cormorants spread their wings to the sun.  They grunt and
bicker amoungst themselves as they do.  The water in the surrounding
swamp gets deeper and deeper.  You hope the path that has been built up
continues on, otherwise it will become very hard to walk.
"   The cormorants have no oil on their feathers so must dry them after swimming
in the water.  They stretch their wings out wide to catch the most sun as
possible.  They are shiney black and have small feather tufts on the tops
of their heads.

146.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   The path here makes a lazy turn to the south and west.  As you peer over
a huge rock you see a small hill in the distance to the east.  The rock looks
unclimbable.  To the south-west is a huge pond covered in lily pads.

147.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   The path here gets even worse.  You are kept out of the water by stepping
stones and rotting logs.  As you step on one log you frighten a poor frog.
He leaps off and disappears into the water.

148.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   As the path worsens you slow down, being careful of every step you make.
One slip and you are in very deep water.  The footing has become treacherous.
You are not sure you can swim carrying all your possesions.

149.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   Each step becomes more dangerous, but you think you can make it.  You
carefully jump from rock to rock.  One rotted log gives out on you but you
catch yourself just in time.  Your heart beats madly with the thought of that
near miss.

150.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You travel on along the path, thinking it has to get better soon.  But it
doesn't get better, if possible it seems to be worse then ever.  You wipe the
sweat from your brow and take another leap.

151.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You walk down a north-south path.  The path has become almost impassable.
If it keeps up like this you will have to find another way through the swamps.
There is a large pond to the west filled with lily pads and frogs croaking
joyfully.

152.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "   You thank your lucky stars as the path improves, and up ahead you see why.
There is a small band of reptiles fixing the path.  They are hauling stone
and trees.  They do not do a great job but it's better than the path you just
crossed.

153.name: On a path in the swamps.
desc: "  A group of hefty reptiles work hard at hauling stone and logs.  They drag
over one fallen tree and plop it right in front of you.  Splash!  They
get water all down your front.  That sure makes you fume!

154.name: Intersection.
desc: "   You stand at the intersection of three paths which come together.  The path
to the north is being fixed by a workcrew.  The path to the south is small and
very soggy.  The path to the east however is spectacular.  It is a wide swath
of grass, five yards wide and lined with flowering fruit trees.  You are sure
the reptiles did not make this, but who did?

155.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   You are on the surface of a large pond.  It stretches out to the north
and west, farther than you can see.  You listen carefully and hear the lazy
hum of damselflies in the distance.

156.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   The pond is still and tranquil, and stretches on forever.  You drift along
in a peaceful daze, listening to the song of a swamp sparrow.  Its monotone
song lulls you into a daydream.

157.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   The pond stretches on and on, never ending.  It's a lovely place to be.  You
dip your hand in the pond to feel the water glide over your fingers.  What a
sensuous feeling.

158.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   The water is getting deeper.  You can no longer see the bottom through the
clear water, but as you take a second look you notice bright flashes of light
in the depths.  Goldfish!  You watch school of goldfish swim lazily back
and forth through the water.

159.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   You drift along admiring the lily pads.  You see a fat contented frog
sitting on one.  He croaks a tune for you, then hops off into the pond.
His splash sends ripples across the pond.

160.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   You drift over some lily pads, with the most beautiful pink flowers.  The
flowers have an incredible number of petals.  You can't resist reaching out
and touching one.  They are soft like the inside of a puppy's ear.

161.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   The pond is very shallow here.  The cattails thrust up from the water,
making a home for the damselflies.  The damselflies look for a few mosquitoes
to have for lunch but there are no mosquitoes to be found in this peaceful
spot.

162.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   The pond continues on in all directions.  Each direction seems as appealing
as the next.  The bright sun shines down reflecting off the water, dazzling
your eyes.

163.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   The deep water glides past underneath you.  The ripples in the pool catch
the sun's rays, turning the water beneath you to diamonds.  Little water
skimmers zip from one glint on the water to the next.

164.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   A large log sticks up from the water.  A mother duck stands on the top
top of it quacking.  As you drift farther in you can see her little ducklings
hiding behind the log in the water.

165.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   The sparkling water look so inviting to swim in.  A cool dip would feel so
good right now, but you've been an adventurer too long.  You know that strange
monsters can lurk in the quietest of places.

166.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   You travel through a forest of cattails.  You hear little rustles in the
plants but can't quite make out their origin.  Then just as you are about to
leave, a small black mouse in a top hat paddles by in a canoe.  He glares at
you and says, "My name is Vach.".

167.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   Small reeds grow at the edge of the pond to the east.  You can see small
marsh birds hunting through them for food.  Their little trills and coos
sound very pleasant.  The pond continues on in all other directions.

168.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   The pond continues on in all directions without end.  The water here seems
very disturbed.  It bubbles and froths as though a large battle were being
waged below you.  The water has been stirred up so badly it has become very
muddy.  You can see nothing as you peer down.

169.name: On an endless pond.
desc: "   The pond here is very deep.  The clear water looks enticing and beautiful.
The water seems to call to you, asking you to revel in it.  Maybe it would
be a good time for a swim.  You feel so hot and sweaty.

170.name: Swimming underwater.
desc: "   You gasp at the chill water, but it feels good as the water caresses your
skin.  The clean water of the lake washes off all the mud and grime.  It
looks like an underground river empties out here to the north, but the
current is to fast to swim against.  You can swim east to a muddy part of
the lake or go up to the surface.

171.name: Swimming underwater.
desc: "   The water here becomes too murky to see through.  It seems to boil around
you, and you feel something thrash in the water.  You feel the sting of
something against your arm, but can't tell what it is.

172.name: Swimming underwater.
desc: "   The bottom of the pond seems to be very rocky.  Long tendrils of weed
grow from between the rocks, threatening to entangle you with every stroke
of your arms.  A small pickerel hides amoung the weeds waiting to ambush
his prey.

173.name: Swimming underwater.
desc: "   The rocky bottom is covered in a weedy growth.  The weeds have one main
stem that reaches for the sunlight.  Around the stem are thousands of tiny
leaves.  The tough stems seem to wrap themselves around you with a mind of
their own.  Pulling your feet from them becomes a difficult task.

174.name: Swimming underwater.
desc: "   The sunlight streaks through the water, lighting up a huge fish.  The huge
pike tries to hide behind the weeds, but with its bulk the little weeds
do nothing to screen it from view.  The Muskie's teeth glitter in the sun.
You think this may be a good fish to stay away from.

175.name: Swimming underwater.
desc: "   You find youself amidst a school of goldfish.  They flash in and out of the
weeds which grow up from the bottom of the pond.  The bottom of the pond here
is sandy, and you see mussels living in the sand.

176.name: Grass alley.
desc: "   You walk over freshly cut grass.  Its scent fills the air around you,
mingling with the smell of apple blossoms.  Tiny flowers dot the lawn, lifting
their cheery faces to the sun.  The alley is lined in flowering trees of every
kind.

177.name: Grass alley.
desc: "   You walk over freshly cut grass.  Beautiful flowering trees line the alley,
and perfume the air with a spicy scent.  Bushes grow in neat little rows
under the trees, and prevent you from going to the north or south.

178.name: Grass alley.
desc: "   You walk over freshly cut grass.  There seems to be a break in the trees
to the north and the south.  As you look each way you see the mud of the
swamp again.  The alley seems like a more pleasant place to be.

179.name: Grass alley.
desc: "   You walk over freshly cut grass.  The flowering tress hang down low,
whispering in the gentle breeze.  Who could have made such a beautiful place?
Maybe you'll find the answer up ahead.

180.name: Grass alley.
desc: "   You walk over freshly cut grass.  The tress lining the alley shower you with
petals.  Each petal is a work of art, perfectly symmetrical and soft as down.
You see a small hole in the bushes to the north, destroying the beautiful
symmetry of the alley.

181.name: Grass alley.
desc: "   You walk over freshly cut grass.  The drone of the honey bees in the flowers
seems peaceful and relaxing.  Wysteria hangs from the tress, their blossoms
a cascade of blue.

182.name: Grass alley.
desc: "   You walk over freshly cut grass.  As you breath in the intoxicating scent
of the trees, you notice the alley opens up to the east.  It becomes a large
meadow with an enormous statue standing in the middle.

183.name: Near a large statue.
desc: "   You stand at the edge of a large meadow.  A huge statue stands on a platform
to the east.  You hear the song of many blue birds in the distance to the north.
The grass alley goes of in the distance to the west.

184.name: Near a large statue.
desc: "   The meadow continues to the south and east.  The trees lining the meadow
hang down low preventing any other exit.  A flock of blue birds twitter in the
trees, occasionally swooping down close to you.

185.name: Near a large statue.
desc: "   The meadow continues in all directions except north.  However, your travel
to the south is blocked by a row of white marble columns.  They tower high
above the meadow, their polished surfaces glinting in the sun.

186.name: Near a large statue.
desc: "   You stand in the north-east corner of a large meadow.  The trees hang down
low from their large load of fruit.  There is a large diversity of fruit,
apples, pears, oranges, plums, cherries, peaches, and so many more.  The fruit
looks delicious.  You reach out to pick one.

187.name: Near a large statue.
desc: "   You stand at the entrance to a large meadow.  The meadow is lined in
flowering trees.  You think you can see fruit laden trees to the north.  To
the west stands a large statue.  To the east is a dark swamp.

188.name: Near a large statue.
desc: "   You stand in the southeast corner of a large meadow.  A lark soars through
the air, singing its songs as it flies. Ti-ti. Ti-ti.  It seems very happy with
life and uplifts your spirits as you watch it.
"   The lark flying through the air looks like a very happy bird.  Its body is
brown, and it has a black tail lined in white.

189.name: Near a large statue.
desc: "   The meadow continues in all directions except south.  However, your travel
to the north is blocked by a row of white marble columns.  They tower high
above the meadow, their polished surfaces glinting in the sun.

190.name: Near a large statue.
desc: "   You stand in the south-west corner of a large meadow.  You can see a huge
statue to the northeast.  A butterfly flits down from the tree and lands on
your head.  As you look up to try to see him better, he flies off.

191.name: Statue of a goddess.
desc: "   You walk up a small flight of white marble steps.  At the top is a platform
with a huge statue.  Large columns of marble flank the statue on either side.
The marble is streaked with gold, silver, and all the colors of the rainbow,
and delicately carved in a filigree of flowers and fruit.
"   The huge statue towers fifty feet into the sky.  It is carved of the same
white marble as the platform and columns.  It is a statue of the Earth goddess.
She is clothed in a flowing robe and wears sandels on her feet.  Her gaze
is stern and looks out across all the swamp.  As you continue to stare at her,
she seems to come to life.  She frowns at you and says, "You are not one of the
cursed.  Mount Amnos and its two races have been cursed for a thousand years.
As long as my blood flows from the earth the curse will hold.  Begone.   Avoid
this swamp and leave now.
"   The huge statue towers fifty feet into the sky.  It is carved of the same
white marble as the platform and columns.  It is a statue of the Earth goddess.
She is clothed in a flowing robe and wears sandels on her feet.  Her gaze
is stern and looks out across all the swamp.  As you continue to stare at her,
she seems to come to life.  She frowns at you and says, "You are not one of the
cursed.  Mount Amnos and its two races have been cursed for a thousand years.
As long as my blood flows from the earth the curse will hold.  Begone.  Avoid
this swamp and leave now.

192.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   You are on a hummock in the swamp.  It's nice being out of the water and
mud but unfortuatly the bushes seem to like it too.  The area is filled with
dense undergrowth, making it hard to see any exits.  You'll have to muscle
your way in each direction to find an exit.

193.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   You feel slightly claustrophobic in this dense brush.  Hopefully it will
open out soon.  As you look down you see the footprints of small creatures.
The paths they use are way too small for you to follow.

194.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   As the bushes close around you, you have a hard time breathing.  As you turn
to leave your arm gets scratched by some thorns.  You look closer and find
a large thorny thicket to the west.  It looks unpassable.

195.name: THORNS!!!
desc: "   You're in a thicket of black raspberries.  It looks like all the raspberries
have been picked off by the birds.  OUCH!  That hurts.  The thorns dig into
your flesh sending blood running down your arms.

196.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   The bushes grab your hair as you walk.  Little scratches form on your arms.
None of the wounds are to serious but its enough to make your mood foul.  As
you fume at the bushes you glance down and find the tracks of some large
animals.  They seem to be going south.

197.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   It is hard work pushing through the thick brush.  You sit down to take a
quick rest and a little mouse runs over your feet.  You quickly jump up and
crash away through the brush.

198.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   The bushes snap and break as you force your way through.  You find yourself
next to a large hollow tree.  The fierce buzzing sound makes you look up.
Hornets swam in and out of the tree.  They must have a very large nest up
there.

199.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   As you shove through the bushes,  the branches seem to shove back at you.
You duck your head to avoid being hit by one branch.  The crows in the trees
laugh at your slow progress.
"   The crow is shiney black, and rather large.  His large beak looks rather
dangrous.  When he caws it seems as if you are being laughed at.

200.name: Lion's den.
desc: "   The thicket has been beaten down here by the weight of many bodies.
As you inch closer you hear the roar of a lion.  He sounds very hungry.
If you run quickly maybe you can escape before his dinnertime.

201.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   You hear branches crack as you push through the brush.  If there are animals
in this thicket, they hear you for miles around.  The footprints in the dirt
go to the east.  The animal has a very large pad reminding you of a dogs
pawprint.

202.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   You look carefully in the dirt and see the hoof prints of a large number
of deer.  It looks like the herd was traveling south.  When you strain your
ears you hear the babbling of a little brook.

203.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   The thicket seems a little beaten down here.  You wonder what could have
caused it.  As you get farther to the north it is even more trampled down.
Maybe you should go north to find out.

204.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   The bushes crowd in on you, scratching your legs.  You give them a hard
kick but they just rebound right back in your face.  As you put your foot
down, you step in the scat of some big animal.

205.name: In a blueberry patch.
desc: "   You push through some branches and find a large patch of blueberries.  You
pick a few and put them in your mouth.  You pick faster and your hands start
to become blue.  In your haste you almost trip over a large sleeping bear.
He must have had his fill of blueberries too.  He's sure to be angry if you
wake him up so you had better tiptoe out of here.

206.name: Crowded by bushes.
desc: "   The bushes here are not quite so dense and they get less dense to the west.
A few little blueberries grow on bushes to the east, making you hungry.  Off
in the distance you hear the babble of a little brook.

207.name: Clearing in the brush.
desc: "   The brush opens up into a clearing.  You can see a flock of crows circling
overhead.  A large herd of dear drink from a little babbling brook.  You look
at the deer and think venison might be a nice addition to dinner tonight.
"   The deer drink quietly from the creek.  Every now and then one pops its
head up listening intently.  When it hears nothing it goes back to drinking
again.  The deer are a solid brown except for the fawns which are spotted.

208.name: Soggy path.
desc: "   The path here is nothing more that a slight rise and a group of footprints
in the mud.  To the south the swamp seems to become overgrown with trees.
They are not so dense as to impede your movement but it looks rather gloomy
there.

209.name: Soggy path.
desc: "   The rise you follow seems to be getting smaller and smaller, and the tress
loom over you blocking out the sun.  You stumble along in the dim light,
straining your eyes to make out the path.

210.name: Soggy path.
desc: "   The rise sinks down into the muck of the swamp.  The gloom closes in about
you.  Then you hear a faint noise to your south.  It sounds like someone
shouting.  It looks like there is a large wooden platform to the south.

211.name: Entrance to the bayou.
desc: "   You stand on a large wooden platform.  To the south a large bayou begins.
Needless to say you'll need a boat to go in there.  If you didn't bring
one Russel the skiff salesman will gladly sell you one.  He shouts, "Skiffs
for sale.  Since you are my favorite customer I'll give you a bargain price.

212.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   The bayou is still and quiet.  Tendrils of mist wrap their arms around
you, drawing you farther in.  You have a disquieting feeling that something
evil and deadly is waiting for you in the mists, but it calls to you with
an attraction you can't resist.

213.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   A small current starts to tug at you.  You can fight against it here but
farther on it seems to become faster.  The thick mist closes in around you
preventing you from seeing where you go.

214.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   The current in the water drags you forward, to unseen places.  The mist
that swirls around you clears for a brief second.  It gives you a quick
glance at the water.  You see the large shapes of manatees in the water.
One comes to the surface and stares at you with pleading eyes.

215.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   The current gives you no rest, but draws you forward throught the mists.
The mists dance around you, covering everthing with a fine spray of water.
You can hear the drip, drip of water from the spanish moss.

216.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   The current threatens to carry you eastward, but the evil draws you south.
You ponder your choices and look south to see what is there, but the mists
block your view.

217.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   The sense of evil becomes oppresive, but where is it coming from?  The
mists taunt you, hiding everything from view.  As you travel farther
south the sense of evil increases.

218.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   You are sure there is something with you in the mists.  You can sense it
even if you can't see it.  The dripping sounds of the spanish moss seem to
get louder and more frequent, and you hear the sound of large feet squishing
in the mud.

219.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   DRIP!  DRIP!  The mists clear for a bit but all you see are the trees
covered in spanish moss.  The clumps of the moss are enormous.  Wait...
was one moss moving in the wind?  It couldn't be, there is no wind.

220.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   You hear the sound of drips in the air.  You cannot tell where they come
from.  It seems as though you are surrounded by them.  The sense of evil
fills the air and threatens to overwhelm you.

221.name: Walking on a Bog.
desc: "   As you step down you feel a very spongy surface under your feet.  You are
walking on the surface of a peat bog.  It seems solid enough to you but it
feels like walking on a trampoline. A massive gate has been erected here,
towering out of the swamp.  The top of the gate is obscured by tendrils of
thick, curling fog that seem to have a life of their own.  Whomever or what-
ever constructed this gate wanted to keep you out... Or something in.  To
the east and west an impenetrable wall of fog extends in to the distance,
preventing you from bypassing this obstacle.
This gate has been constructed of an unknown material that is cold and harsh
to the touch, as if it somehow wants to stick to you, to infect you.  A nice
design of a frog, that we have come to recognise as the Slaadi overlords of
Dark Horn Hill, has been carved in to the gate and a strange halo of flames
floats an inch or so above it's amphibious head, moving and dancing as if a
breeze blows against the fiery tendrils.  Behind all this a whirlpool swirls
slowly in a never ending dance.  No doubt impressive, maybe it is also a
clue?
Now well known as the Dark Wind, this magically created fog is the will of
the Slaadi, invading and cursing the land, twisting the creatures therein
and possessing all with evil.  The fog is known to seep endlessly from the
Plane of Frogs and provides a crucial life-line for the Slaadi and their
Sahougin minions.  Take care not to breathe too much of it in, for you too
might well succumb to the deadly embrace of the Dark Wind.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

222.name: Walking on a bog.
desc: "   You walk on the top of a peat bog.  You stumble across some strange ugly
flowers.  You bend closer and peer through the mist.  They are the flowers
of a sundew plant.

223.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "  You follow the current of the bayou.  Thump!  Something bumps into your
skiff.  You peer over the edge and see two large eyes staring back at you.
Only the eyes are out of the water.  Then suddenly, the crocodile flashes
up and ...

224.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   The current drags you farther and farther into the bayou.  You peer
cautiously over the edge of your skiff, but nothing seems to be in the
water.  You breath a sigh of relief.

225.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   As you float along clothed in mist, you hear grunts and chitters up above
you.  A big shriek goes up then there silence.  All of a sudden you are
pelted by rotten fruit and loud hoots can be heard all around you.  You think
the sounds are made by monkeys, and revenge would be very sweet right now.

226.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   The mist starts clearing out allowing you to see your surroundings.  Huge
trees hang down over the swamp, their branches laced in spanish moss.  You see
a large stagnant area to the north.  It smells of rotting vegetation.

227.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   The mist has totally cleared up.  You might be happier if it hadn't.  This
place is dismal and grey.  Even the leaves on the trees look more grey than
green.  The trees block out all the sun, and you pine for its warmth.

228.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   You travel through an area gloomy area.  Your spirits sink and you become
discouraged with life.  You take a small whiff of the air and gag on the
thick smell of rot.

229.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   You are in the northeast corner of a large area smelling of rotting
vegetation.  You try to hold your nose but the smell can't be kept out.
The smell gets in your clothing and you try to remember where the nearest
dry cleaners is.

230.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   You are in a large area of stagnation.  The smell is oppresive.  You can
go east to a less smelly place or south to what looks like a small river.
The area of stagnation continues to the north and west.

231.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   You float langidly along the bayou.  The water seems very clear here.  You
drag you fingers through the water, making patterns of ripples around your
boat.  Then, OUCH, something has bit your finger.  You put your fingers in
your mouth and look over the side.  A couple of snapping turtles swim in
the water.

232.name: Floating along the bayou.
desc: "   You are at the end of a large bayou.  The bayou continues off the the west.
To the north is a small muddy path, not much used.  The trees are thick here
cutting out the sun and the warmth.  A small shiver runs down your spine from
the cold.

233.name: Muddy path.
desc: "   You slog through the mud.  Pick up one foot put it down.  Pick up the other
put it down.  Traveling along the faint path has started to hypnotize you.
You lift your bleary eyes and look south. You see the start or is it the end
of a huge bayou.

234.name: Muddy path.
desc: "   You trudge down another boring path in the mud.  You wonder why the
goddess who made this place couldn't have magically made all the areas
connected together without the paths.  You know she could have done it.

235.name: Muddy path.
desc: "   You find this the most boring path you have travelled so far.  The mud
is a uniform depth, no surprises anywhere.  It's just deep enough to be
annoying but not so deep to make it dangerous or hard to travel.

236.name: Muddy path.
desc: "  The path makes a wide turn to the south and west.  As you gaze south, you
see stretched before you a uniform grey path.  It has to be the most mundane
place you have ever gone.

237.name: Muddy path.
desc: "   You stand at the beginning of a small muddy path.  The path continues off
to the east.  To the north, you see a beautiful grassy path.  It sees perfect
for that picnic with your special someone.

238.name: Following a river.
desc: "   You float down a very small river.  The water is sluggish and flows to the
east.  You hear the chitter of monkeys in the trees and frown.  As you scan the
trees looking for them the sound fades away.

239.name: Following a river.
desc: "   A large tree looms from the side of the river.  It looks like a troop of
monkeys lives here from time to time.  Feces and trash litter the area under
the tree.  A small monkey child leans over the river for a drink.

240.name: Following a river.
desc: "   The river picks up speed, taking you quickly to the south.  As you flash
by you see many signs of the monkeys.  There must be a huge population
in this corner of the swamps.

241.name: Following a river.
desc: "   You come to a small rapids in the river.  A large hole on the left side
of the river threatens to flip your boat,  but you quickly paddle to the
right avoiding it.  A wave splashes in your face, drenching you from head
to foot.

242.name: Following a river.
desc: "   The river takes a large bend to the west and north.  As it carries you on
you wonder if you'll be able to get back.  It will be very hard work paddling
back upstream against the current.

243.name: Following a river.
desc: "   A huge troop of baboons stares at you silently from the trees.  They watch
you float down the river.  They seem to be gauging you, whether they should
view you as a threat to their territory or not.

244.name: Following a river.
desc: "  The river seems to be taking many twists and turns.  Here it bends from the
south to the east. As you look farther down the river it seems to loop
around on itself.

245.name: Following a river.
desc: "   A huge log blocks the river.  You scramble quickly to get to the shore.
You barely make it there before getting stuck.  You have a hard time pushing
your way through the trees to make the portage.

246.name: Following a river.
desc: "   As the river twists from the south to the east, it gets deeper and deeper.
Little whirlpools swirl by under you.  In the center of each whirlpool is
a patch of dirty brown foam.

247.name: Following a river.
desc: "   The whirlpools follow you down the river.  As the river gets deeper the
whirlpools get larger.  Little bits of leaf and branch seem to be stuck
in them, twirling around and around.  They mesmerize you as you watch them.
You finally tear your gaze away and go on.

248.name: Following a river.
desc: "   The whirlpools become violent and threaten to pull your boat under.  You
boat rocks back and forth and you paddle desperately to keep away from them.
You see a lake to the south, a haven from the whirlpools.

249.name: On a lake.
desc: "   You find yourself at the beginning a deep lake.  You try to look down
into the depths but you see nothing, just an endless blue.  Large whirlpools
in a river are to your north.  To your south and west the lake continues.

250.name: On a lake.
desc: "  A gentle breeze blows over the lake, creating small ripples on the surface of
the water.  The air pulls at your hair, twisting it into tangles.  The lake
continues on to the east and the south.

251.name: On a lake.
desc: "   The wind blows fiercly here.  It tugs and pulls at the water.  Little
whirlpools start to form on the surface.  The wind gets stronger and one
whirlpool starts to grow.  You start going in circles around it.

252.name: On a lake.
desc: "   The trees open up above you and the sun shines down on the sparkling blue
water.  The light does not seem to penatrate the water.  The lake continues
to the north and the west.

253.name: In an underwater hall.
desc: "   The whirlpool deposits you in a large underwater hallway.  To the south the
hall has caved in preventing your exit in that direction.  You recognize the
hallway as dwarven built.  The hall continues to the north.

254.name: In an underwater hall.
desc: "   There are two large doors on either side of you.  You tug as hard as you
can on them but they seem to be stuck fast.  There is a large cave in to
the north.  If you climb up the stones of the caved in walls you might be
able to reach the next level up, or you can go down the hall to the south.

255.name: In an old library.
desc: "   You drag yourself out of the water and onto a damp slimy floor.  The walls
drip with water and are covered in shelves filled with books, or what was
once books.  Most of the books seem to have rotted.

256.name: In an old library.
desc: "   Books line the walls of this old library.  Most of them have rotted away,
but you can still find a few whole ones.  You take one down from the shelf
and it starts to shred in your hands.  The writing seems strange to you
until you realize it is written in an old dwarven tongue.

257.name: In an old library.
desc: "   Books line the walls of this old library.  Most of them have rotted away,
but you can still find a few whole ones.  You take one down from the shelf
and open it up.  The inside is riddled with maggots.

258.name: In an old library.
desc: "   You stand at the entrance to an ancient library.  It seems to belong to
another age.  There was once a door here, but it has been ripped off its
hinges and lies on the floor.  A hallway goes to the north.

259.name: In an old hallway.
desc: "   You follow an old decrepit hall.  The walls look like they may fall down
at any minute.  The stones were once well put together, but something has
torn many of them down.  The hall continues to the north and there is an
old library to the south.

260.name: In an old hallway.
desc: "  The hall has collapsed to the north.  There is too much rubble to go forward.
You notice two large columns flanking the hall.  They are large and ornate and
have intricate carvings on their surface.
"   The whirlpool grows deeper and deeper and you find yourself being sucked
down deeper into it.  You spin around and around, getting dizzier as you
as you spin.  The water starts getting in your mouth and you choke.

262.name: By a large web.
desc: "   You stand before a huge spider web.  It is strung up between two enormous
trees, that stand widely apart.  There is no way around the web, but you can
climb up it if you dare.

263.name: On the outside of the web.
desc: "   It looks like if you go up for a while you will get to the center of th
web.  Little baby spiders swarm over the web, ignoring your presence.  The
silk of the web digs into your hands as you climb.

264.name: On the outside of the web.
desc: "   You climb at the bottom of the web.  The strands of the web are very easy
to climb.  They seem slightly sticky but not so bad that you can't move around.
The web continues to the west and up.

265.name: On the outside of the web.
desc: "   You are at the western most part of the web.  An egg sack hangs off one
strand of web.  You are sure the mother spider would get very angry if
you fiddled with it.

266.name: On a web.
desc: "   You stand very close to the center of the web.  Just above your head sits
and enormous spider.  She hasn't noticed you yet and maybe you should keep
it that way.

267.name: On a web.
desc: "   You stand directly east of the center of the web.  A huge spider hangs there,
waiting for prey.  You get the impression that you would make a very tasty
morsel for her.  You can go down and leave the web.

268.name: On the outside of the web.
desc: "   You are climbing up the eastern most part of the web.  Little spiders
scurry back and forth along every strand of the web.  Ick, one little spider
runs over your hand almost causing you to let go and plummet to your death.

269.name: On the outside of the web.
desc: "   You are at the western most part of the web.  Little baby spiders skitter
over the web.  One group of them starts to make silk.  The wind picks up
the small strands of silk, and the little spiders ballon off into the air.

270.name: On a web.
desc: "   The little spiders seem to be in a mass exodus to the west.  What could
they be trying to find there?  A strong breeze blows toward the west, ruffling
your hair.  You glance to the east and see the center of the web.

271.name: Sticky web.
desc: "   The web gets stickier here.  You have trouble getting your hands and feet
off of the web with each step.  You aren't the only one who seems to have
trouble,  a huge fly seems trapped here, buzzing consantly as it tries to
dislodge itself.

272.name: On the outside of the web.
desc: "   You climb up the eastern most part of the web.  You can feel a gentle breeze
blowing across the web here.  The little spiders seem to be all going to the
west.  You look west and see a huge fly stuck in the web.

273.name: Sticky web.
desc: "   You have climbed to the top of the web.  The view here is amazing.  To the
east you see a huge statue towering over the trees.  A small hill crawling
with black blobs lies to the north.  As you turn to the west you see a large
pond and the path on which you entered the swamp.

274.name: STUCK!
desc: "   You try to pull your hand from the web.  You tug with all of your strength,
but you are stuck fast.  You mind drifts to the large spider that built
this web, and you efforts become more frantic.  Your efforts are all in
vain however, you seem to be stuck here forever.

275.name: In the center of the web.
desc: "   You find yourself clinging to the center of the web.  A huge spider lies
in wait for its dinner.  She seems as tall as you, and you rethink your
decision to climb this web.  She had her back turned to you when you entered,
but she must have felt your vibrations on the web.  She nimbly turnes around
facing you.....

276.name: STUCK!
desc: "   You try to pull your hand from the web.  You tug with all of your strength,
but you are stuck fast.  Your mind drifts to the large spider that built
this web, and your efforts become more frantic.  Your efforts are all in
vain however, you seem to be stuck here forever.

277.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   You stand in a cul-de-sac off the edge of the battlefield.  The wind howls
more fiercely here, threatening to pull you off your feet.  It whips you
around, pushing you toward the west.

278.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   The battlefield stretches off in all directions.  The wind wraps itself
around you, and sends up a fearsome howl.  Its cold fingers touches your
face sending shivers of fear down your spine.

279.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   Little bits of bone lie scattered.  No bone is whole.  All are splintered
or turned to dust.  Some strange force must have pulverised them.  You glance
behind yourself in fear but see nothing.

280.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   You stand on the battlefield of the great war.  The ghosts of ancient
warriors sing songs of glory and grief in your ears, or is it just the wind
whispering by?

281.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   The swamp slowly buries the bones in the mud.  It has taken centuries
but half a torso has already sunk into the muck.  In a few more centuries
the bones will rest peacefully in a muddy grave.

282.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   You see the corpse of a young man, his face in the mud.  He seems to have
no wounds on him anywhere.  What could have killed him?  As you turn him
over his face is frozen in a look of utter horror.

283.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   Piles on piles of bone lie here, all bleached white by centuries of time.
The wind rattles the bones, and eerie sound that send shivers down your
spine.  The bones do not seem to rest easily.

284.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   Steel grey skies reflect off the shallow water.  North, east, and south, a
very old battlefield extends for as far as your eye can see.  No living trees
grow from this fetted place.  Only a few dead trees rear their heads.  They
stand as skeletons against the sky, forboding the fate of all who dare enter.

285.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   Piles of bones bleached white from time, rest here.  You are loath to disturb
their rest.  Thousands have died here, their flesh washed away by the wind and
rain.  Their only eulogy, the whistling of the wind.  Their only headstone,
the dead stark tress.

286.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   Two vultures wheel in the sky.  They circle above you.  You get the
impression they know something you don't.  You whirl around looking for
signs of life but see nothing.

287.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   A few bones lie here cracked open.  You see a vulture circling in the sky.
He carries a bone in his talons and when he gets over a large rock he drops
it.  Its shatters on impact.  The vulture swoops down to eat the marrow from
the center of the bone, but after centuries of the bone sitting in the swamp,
he finds nothing.

288.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   An old steel sword sticks up out of the mud.  Its handle is beautifully
carved in an abstract pattern.  There was once a large stone attached but
someone has long since pried it off.  As you pull the sword out of the mud
you see the blade has corroded in the swamp muck.

289.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   The wind shrieks about the bones.  One delicate leg bone has broken and as
the wind gusts over it, a mournful whistle goes up in the air.  It is a
beautiful yet haunting sound, well suited to the elf of long ago who lost his
life in the war.

290.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   The piles of bone shake in the wind.  Several of them seem to move closer
to other bones.  You watch in horror as you see a whole skeleton slowly
coming together.  As the head fits on the the neck,  it turns to you and gives
you an eyeless leer.

291.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   You trip over something lodged in the mud.  You look down and pull out
a pouch made of leather.  How could leather have survived all these years
since the war?  As you pick it up it disintegrates in your hands and three
small vials fall out and smash on the ground.

292.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   The piles of bone here seem less touched by time.  Each skeleton is whole.
No animal has picked through the pile, disturbing the bones.  Time seems to
have preserved them just as they died.

293.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   You turn your eyes to the steel grey sky.  The clouds floating by seem to
all blend together, until you see one lighter than the rest.  It is in the
shape of an elf and a dwarf engaged in combat.

294.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   You stand at the edge of a huge battlefield.  It reeks of age and decay.
The grey water is still and unappealing.  You hesitate to move back into
the heart of the battlefield.

295.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "  The wind howls and screeches over huge piles of bone.  The sound grates on
your nerves and disorients you.  You put hands over your ears to block
out the noise and plunge away in a random direction.

296.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   A corroded suit of armor lies stuck in the mud.  It may once have been
worn by a dwarf of the royal family, for the parts that haven't been corroded
away seem beautiful and ornately decorated.

297.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   Two whole skeletons lie here frozen in time.  Each one has their hands
wrapped around the others neck.  One skeleton is short, with thick and
sturdy bones.  The other is tall, with slender fragile bones.
