298.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   The bones are piles up against a large rock to the west.  The rock looks
unclimbable, but you can pick your way through the bones in any other
direction.
"   The rock stands tall and shear.  You lack the climbing skill to get over
it but you wonder what can be there.  The rock is grey, much the same color
of the water and the sky.

299.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   A strange glow lights up the air.  You seem oppresed by an unseen evil.
The air seems to close in around you keeping you from breathing.  You have
an irresistable urge to flee.

300.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   The wind twists and turns through the pile of bones.  Little whirlwinds
carry bits of leave through a rib cage, burying it ever deeper in the ground.
A skeletal hand half buried in the ground beseeches you for everlasting rest.

301.name: On an ancient battlefield.
desc: "   You stand in the mud looking out in all directions.  Each direction seem
the same as any other.  The ancient battlefield seems to stretch out in all
dirctions with no end.

302.name: Lair.
desc: "  The wind pushes you along forcing you into the lair of something.  You look
around and see nothing except half eaten corpses, some old and some new.  You
have the impression that you will be the newest corpse here.

303.name: Entrance to hot springs.
desc: "   You stand at the entrance to an area of heavy geothermal activty.  Hot water
boils and bubbles up around you.  Someone has built up wooden boardwalks to
keep you from getting burned in the water.  You look down into the water and see
that it is clouded with brown growths that thrive in all the minerals.

304.name: Hot springs.
desc: "   You follow one branch of the boardwalk.  You look down into the water.  It
steams a bit but doesn't seem too hot.  The water appears scummy and brown.
You can continue the north or south along the boardwalk.

305.name: Deep blue pool.
desc: "   You come to the end of te boardwalk.  There is a railing at the end and
some tourists leaning way over it.  You hope it is strong enough to hold them.
A small box with a slot in the lid is nailed firmly to a rail post.  You
walk over to the railing and look down.  You see the most beautiful sight in
the world.  A pool going deep down into the earth.  It is round and deep
blue.  Towards the center the blue is the color of sapphires.  Towards the
sides the color starts to lighten and turn blue-green.
"   There is a small wooden box tacked on to the post.  It has a slot in the
top the size of a gold coin.  There are some words burned into the side of
the box, "Donations for the upkeep of this area are appreciated.  Without
donations the boardwalk to Morning Glory Pool can not be maintained.

306.name: Hot springs.
desc: "   You follow the largest of the boardwalks.  You are very glad someone built
them.  The water seem to be deep in places and shallow in others.  In the
shallow areas the bottom seems to be of some brittle rock.  You wonder if it
would collapse below you when you walk on it.

307.name: Hot springs.
desc: "   The boardwalk makes a sharp turn from the south to the east.  There is a
little sign which reads, "You are entering an area of dangerous thermal
activity.  Please stay on the boardwalks for your own safety.

308.name: Hot springs.
desc: "   The boardwalk turns from the west to the north.  There is a large railing
to the south.  A small sign has been tacked to the railing.  You look over
the railing and see a bubbling mud puddle.  Large bubbles of steam slowly
move to the surface.  When it reaches the top the mud bubble bursts open
splattering mud everywhere.
|     This boiling mud is       |
|          DANGEROUS            |
|      Please do not lean       |
|       over the railing.       |

309.name: Boiling mud.
desc: "   You stand in a boiling pit of mud.  You sink down slowly in the mud.  It
comes up to your knees.  If you don't get out soon you'll be boiled alive,
or suffocated in mud.  You're not quite sure which will happen first.  Quick,
The mud now comes up to your thighs........

310.name: Hot springs.
desc: "   The boardwalk goes north-south here.  There is a railing to the west.
There are tourists waiting impatently around.  A few of them check their
watches.  Then one lets out a shout, as you see a huge geyser spout into
the air to the west.  The tourists clap with glee.

311.name: Hot springs.
desc: "   You have come to the end of the boardwalk.  Your tour ends here.  There
seems to be a large warm pool to the north.  You see a few tourists there
bathing in the mineral rich water.  To the west is a large flat area of
hot springs.  You think you could pick your way through it safely.

312.name: Geysers.
desc: "   Little bits of steam spurts up occasionally making you jump.  You know if
you are here when the geyser goes off you are in deep trouble.  So maybe now
is the time to leave.

313.name: Hot springs.
desc: "   You carefully make you way through the hot springs.  The hot water is
rather pleasing to your toes.  To the west you see a falls, to the south
is the geyser, and to the east is the boardwalk.

314.name: Travertine falls.
desc: "   You stand at the bottom of some spectacular travertine falls.  The falls
are about twenty feet high, and water tumbles in multiple cascades over the
travertine.  The brown travertine looks climbable but rather sharp.

315.name: Travertine pool.
desc: "   You climb the side of the falls, trying to stay out of the water spray.
When you are at the top, you see there all falls on all sides.  The mineral
laden water coming deep from the earth has built up its own large bowl.
The other three sides look unclimbable.

316.name: Warm pool.
desc: "   You are in a large but shallow pool of warm water.  The smell of sulfer
fills the air.  A row of tourists soaking in the mineral water seem quite
content with life.  They chat amongst themselves happily.

317.name: Hot water.
desc: "   The pool of water seems to be quite hot here.  Only a few brave tourists
sit in the water.  It is too hot for them to be totally submurged so only
their legs and bottoms are in the water.  The flesh under the water looks
quite red.

318.name: Hot water.
desc: "   The water here is hotter than the pools to the south, but still bearable.
You look north and see a huge mud puddle there.  You know from past experience
that mud puddles can be quite dangerous.  To the east the hot spring continues.

319.name: Uncomfortably hot water.
desc: "   The water becomes very hot.  You take quick mincing steps to keep your feet
cool enough to walk.  Your ankles become beet red.  You hope you can find a
cooler place to walk since you are becoming very uncomfortable.  You see steam
coming from the north.

320.name: Uncomfortably hot water.
desc: "   Ouch!  The water seems almost too hot to walk in.  Steam comes off the
water making it difficult to see.  You can vaguely tell the stream continues
to the south and west.

321.name: Boiling water.
desc: "   The water boils up around your feet.  It burns your feet, turning them
to one big blister.  The steam comes up around you and as you breathe it in
it sears your lungs.  You can follow the stream to its source, westward.

322.name: Boiling water.
desc: "   Your choice of following the stream to its source seems like a very bad one
now.  The water only gets hotter.  Soon you will be nothing more than a
scalded corpse.  You can continue following the stream to the west or you
can go back the way you came to the east.

323.name: Boiling water.
desc: "   You are being boiled to death by the hot stream.  You can barely breath
and your lungs feel scorched.  The stream takes a turn to the south and east.
Maybe you should turn back now before you die.

324.name: Mud puddle.
desc: "   You slowly sink down in the mud.  You stop sinking when it gets to your
thighs.  You sigh and struggle to get out, but you find yourself held fast
in the mud.  No amount of effort will free you.

325.name: Source of the hot spring.
desc: "   The hot spring boils out of a gash in the ground.  You are astonished by
its color.  As it leaves the ground it is a thick red.  As it gets farther
and farther from it source it thins out and becomes clearer.  At three feet
from the gash it is as clear as any water in the hot springs.  To your east
is a huge mud puddle, to the north all you can see is steam, to the west
are some bushes that you might be able to push through.
"   You look at the liquid poring out of the gash.  Its color intrigues you.
You reach out to put your hand in it and ouch!  It is boiling hot, but as
you take your hand out you notice no wounds or blisters.  Your hand feels
just fine.

326.name: Trapped in the mud.
desc: "   Too late!!!  The mud sucks you down.  First your waist disappears, then your
shoulders, last your head goes under.  You are suffocating on the mud.  You
try valiantly to hold your breath, but you know it will give out soon.
Exits: Ha! There is no exit to this pit of death.

327.name: Mud puddle.
desc: "   You slowly sink down in the mud.  You stop sinking when it gets to your
thighs.  You sigh and struggle to get out.  but you find yourself held fast
in the mud.  No amount of effort will free you.

328.name: In a geyser.
desc: "   You are thrown up by the geyser.  The water is so hot it scalds you.  You
try to get out but are trapped by hot water all around you.  You'll just have
to wait until the geyser is done.

329.name: Under the mud pit.
desc: "   You feel hands pulling at your feet.  Then, plop, you are out.  You have
been pulled under the mud into a small cavern.  The cavern is filled with mud.
The floors are covered with it as are the walls.  Mud drips down from the
ceiling.  You look around for who saved you from the mud pit and you see small
blobs of mud laughing and skittering away.

330.name: Under the mud pit.
desc: "   You are in a huge cavern made of mud.  The cavern goes off the to north
and east.  There is a small alcove to the south.  A group of mud blobs laugh
at you and one pelts you with a ball of mud.

331.name: Under the mud pit.
desc: "   There are lots of chittering mud blobs all around the cavern.  They come
in all shapes and sizes.  They seem able to change shape at will.  This
could be potentialy hazardous if you try to kill them.  They might just
change their bodies to avoid your weapon.

332.name: Under the mud pit.
desc: "   The blobs of mud here are getting overly rambunctious.  They run up to you,
flinging mud in your face.  Then they dance back.  They might have saved you
from the mud pit just to keep you as a play thing for all eternity.

333.name: Under the mud pit.
desc: "   The cavern ceiling drips down on you with annoying regularity.  Each drop
of mud makes your temper flair.  You have to find a way out of here, but
where?  The cavern stretches out to the east and the south.  There is a
small alcove to the north.

334.name: Under the mud pit.
desc: "   You are in a small alcove to the north of the large mud cavern.  Its seems
much more mud splattered here.  The mud blobs stand outside the alcove
watching you.  They refuse to enter which cheers you somewhat.
"   The mud below you starts to sputter.  Then a huge gush of mud erupts
out of the floor below you.  You fly through the air and are pushed through
the mud ceiling, back into the mud pits by the tourists.

335.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You find yourself on a path around a small hill.  To the east is a patch of
very thick bushes, too thick to push your way through.  The path continues to
the south and west.

336.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You follow a north-south path around a small hill.  There is a large group
of rocks to the west going up the hill.  They seem too difficult to climb up.
You see a small hole under one rock at the top.  You wonder what animal lives
all the way up there.

337.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You follow a north-south path around a small hill.  A large group of
rocks lies to the west.  The rock face seems to go to the top of the hill,
but it is very hard to see from the bottom.  You try to climb up one of the
rocks but you slip and fall back.

338.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You are at a turn in the path.  It goes to the to the north and west.  To
the north-west you see a large rock face going up the hill.  The rock formation
look like it belongs at the top of a craggy peak, not a small little hill.

339.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You follow an east-west path around a hill.  To the north is a large
vertical rock face.  You see a group of climbers being led by a tour guide.
They slowly make their way up the face banging in pitons as they go.

340.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You follow an east-west path around a hill.  The large face to the north
continues.  A three foot wide crack goes all the way up the face.  Three
climbers all roped together inch their way up the chimney.

341.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You follow an east-west path around a hill.  You are at the edge of a large
cliff face.  The sound of a group of teenagers laughing, makes you look up.
You see them rappelling down the cliff under the instruction of a capable
looking guide.

342.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You find yourself at a turn in the path.  To the north the path gets very
narrow.  You look south and see the top of a huge spider web.  It looks like
a person is stuck up there.  He struggles and tries very hard to get out.
You shake your head and mumble under your breath that newbies never learn.

343.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You follow a north-south path.  It narrows down here considerably, hemming
you in on both sides.  The brush is just at eye level and occasionally you
get a glimpse of the pond to the west.

344.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You continue to follow a north-south path.  There is heavy brush to the
west that you can just peek over.  As you glance over you see a huge fish
jump out of the pond with an adventurer in its mouth.  The person valiantly
tries to defend himself.

345.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   As you walk around the hill on the path, you come across a large rock.
You can easily hop on top of it and look down.  You see the main path
through the swamps down there.  If you wish you can jump down, but you don't
think you'll be able to get back.

346.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You stand on a path at the bottom of a hill.  You can see the top of the
hill to your southeast.  The rocks jut out from the hill like a majestic peak.
The rock formations look misplaced on a small hill.

347.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   The path makes an abrupt turn to the east and south.  The path is muddier
here and you can see numerous footprints in the mud.  Whatever made the prints
must be very heavy because the footprints go very deep into the mud.

348.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   You walk along and east-west path.  You see numerous footprints in the dirt.
The footprints are webbed and have three toes.  Many of them lead to the south.
What kind of creature would need webbed feet to live on a hill?

349.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   The path travels to the west and south.  The path is much rockier here.
Chunks of bedrock cut through the earth making your footing treacherous.
You see scuffle marks in the dirt under the rocks.  As you bend down to
examine them you notice a brown stain against one of the rocks.

350.name: On a path by a hill.
desc: "   The small path curves to the north and east.  You stumble over a bunch
of rocks strewn across the path.  Then, ouch, one hits you on your head.
You look up and see a small black creature kicking rocks down on you.  When
he notices you look up, he flees into a small hole.

351.name: On a hill.
desc: "   You are climbing up the side of a hill.  To the south is the top.  You
think you can make it up, but it looks like a very hard climb.  To your east
is a straight drop down, much too difficult to climb.

352.name: On a hill.
desc: "   You huff and puff as you climb the side of a hill.  The top of the hill
is to the east.  It looks like a laborious climb but not impossible.  Or you
can go south going around the hill.

353.name: On the top of a hill.
desc: "   You stand on the top of Amnos Hill.  Once a great mountain, now it has
sunk deep into the mud of the swamp.  Even though it is much diminished in
stature it still provides a spectacular view of the countryside.  To the
east you can see the ocean in the distance.  At the edge you see a town
which must be Old Port.  To the north you see a fortress resting high up
in the mountains.  To the west is the capitol, Arador and you can barely
make out a large marsh just past it.  To the south you see a huge chasm and
the dwarven range.  Rumor has it that dwarves once lived here when this hill
was still a mountain.  Once there might have been tunnels connecting the
two dwarven kingdoms.

354.name: On a hill.
desc: "   You see a black creature four feet tall with webbed feet.  He looks over
the edge of the cliff to the north, throwing down rocks and cackling.  Then
all of a sudden he whirls around and sees you.  He quickly scampers down
a dark hole.

355.name: On a hill.
desc: "   You are at the edge of a cliff.  A group of teenagers are resting here.
It looks as though they have just finished climbing up the face and are
getting ready to rappel back down.

356.name: On a hill.
desc: "   You stand at the edge of a large cliff face.  Directly below you is a crack
in the face about three feet wide.  There is a small group of climbers slowly
inching their way up the chimney.

357.name: On a hill.
desc: "   You stand at the edge of a large cliff to the south and east.  You would
never be able to climb down it but you see a group of climbers coming up
the face.  They pound in their pitons sending ringing sounds all over the
hill.

358.name: Collapsed tunnel.
desc: "   The fit is very tight.  You squeeze between some rocks.  You crawl on
your belly trying not to get stuck.  The weight of the hill seems to push
down on you and you start to have trouble breathing.

359.name: In an ancient hallway.
desc: "   You follow an old dark hallway under the hill.  The walls of stone seem
sturdy and very well made.  To the south is a cave in.  You wonder what
could have caused such sturdy walls to collapse.

360.name: In an ancient hallway.
desc: "   There are two doorways to the east and west.  Beautiful columns flank
either side of the doors.  The work could only be dwarven.  No other race
has such talent.  You tug on the eastern door but its metal has rusted
shut over time.

361.name: Over an ancient stairwell.
desc: "   You stand at the top of a beautiful ornate staircase. It is eight feet wide
and spirals down into the darkness.  It is all carved from the bedrock of
this place.  Even the handrail seems to be carved right from the original
stone.  The place smells musty and you hear the faint slosh of water against
the walls.

362.name: Under an ancient stairwell.
desc: "   You find yourself at the bottom of an old ornate stairwell.  The whole
place seems to be flooded.  The water you breathe seems foul and tainted.  A
huge hallway stretches off the the west.

363.name: In an underwater hallway.
desc: "   You stand in a hallway that once went east-west.  Now the western side
has collapsed.  To the south is a large room.  It once had a door, but now
the door lays on it side in the hall.

364.name: In an old sitting room, underwater.
desc: "   You are in an old sitting room.  There is a small statue of Gilfor towards
the eastern edge of the room.  It is beautifully carved.  Anything else that
was once in this room has long since rotted in the water.

365.name: In an old sitting room, underwater.
desc: "   This large sitting room was once where people waited to see the king.  A
few chairs are left, the ones that were made of stone.  The room continues
to the east, and an hallway is to the north.  There was once a door between
the hall and this room but the stone door now lies on the ground.

366.name: In an underwater hallway.
desc: "   There is a stairway going up out of the water.  The walls of the stairway
are covered in crests and symbols.  The topmost one is a crest of the
dwaven king Gilfor.  The hall continues to the north and east, but the
eastern section has collapsed.

367.name: In an underwater hallway.
desc: "   You follow an hallway that goes north-south.  The water here tastes
old and stale.  This place must have been underwater for a long time.
There small shelves carved in the stone at regular intervals along the
way.  Small stone carvings line the shelves.
"   The carvings are all small and made of stone.  They picture the everyday
life of a dwarf.  The most frequent themes are of the forge.  Many little
carvings show the dwaves working metal, pounding it on the anvil and pouring
it into molds.

368.name: In an underwater hallway.
desc: "   Two enormous doors are on either side of the hallway.  The doors are made
of solid stone but the hall seems to have crumbled a bit around them and
now they are impossible to open.  Beautiful columns held up either side of
the door but now they are cracked and parts have fallen onto the floor.

369.name: In an underwater hallway.
desc: "   The vile taste of the water seems to be getting worse.  You wonder if the
taste comes from those awful swamp creatures.  The walls here are plain cut
stone, and they seem to have held up fairly well.  There are no cracks
running down the walls here and each stone seems perfectly placed.

370.name: In an underwater hallway.
desc: "   You stand underneath a wide stairway that goes up to the west.  The stairs
seem to be covered in gold.  There are numerous scratches in them as though
someone had tried to scrape off the gold.  But the gold remains indelibly
fused to the stone.

371.name: In a throne room.
desc: "   You find yourself in a very old throne room.  The walls are covered in
rich tapestries, and beautiful statues line the room.  The room seems
heaped in treasure.
"   You look at the beautifully carved statues.  They are statues of dwaven
kings.  Fourty-eight of them line the walls.  One for each king who ruled
under Mount Amnos.
"   You look at the beautifly woven tapestries.  They seem dusty and very old.
One huge tapestry catches your eye.  The tapestry is of a huge mountain
covered in forest.  You can see little figures of dwarves coming out of the
mountain.  They seem to be trading peacefully with a group of elves.

372.name: In a throne room.
desc: "   You are in the middle of an enourmous throne room.  The throne itself lies
to the south, and an ugly beast rest on it.  To the east lies the stairway
going back to the underwater hallway.

373.name: In a throne room.
desc: "   You stand next to a large throne.  All around the throne lies piles and
piles of treasure.  You reach out to take a large diamond but as you do the
hideous beast on the throne slaps your hand.  He says, "I am king Gilfor.
Do not touch that, it is mine to keep... forever!

374.name: In a throne room.
desc: "   You are in the middle of a throne room.  To the west is the throne itself.
It seems to have a hideous creature on it.  To the north is the stairway
back to the underwater hallway.

375.name: In an ancient hallway.
desc: "   You stand at the top of the huge stairway lined in gold.  The water comes
all the way up to the last stair and slops over the edge a bit.  The air
here is old and stale.  You worry that it may not be good to breathe.

376.name: In an ancient hallway.
desc: "   You stand in a musty old hallway.  It was once very beautiful but now
spiderwebs hang from the walls and ceilings.  Dust covers every surface and
puddles of water seep along the floor.  There are two alcoves to the north
and south.  They have no doors and seem very functional and unadorned.

377.name: In an ancient hallway.
desc: "   You walk down a very orante part of the hallway.  Handsome oak columns
once held up the lintels to two huge doors, but now they have rotted out
and parts of them have fallen down.  The doors, also made from oak, have
rotted off their hinges and now just lean against the stone walls of the rooms.

378.name: In an ancient hallway.
desc: "   You are in a very ornate hallaway.  The oak columns here have stood the
test of time much better than those to the east.  Though they have rotted
out slightly at the bottom, they still do their jobs of holding the lintels
up.  The oak doors are closed and swelled shut, totally immobile.  You can
still get in the rooms however, because someone has chopped away some of the
rotted wood at the bottom.  The holes are a tight squeeze but you won't get
stuck in them.

379.name: In an ancient hallway.
desc: "   On either side of the hall are two huge doors.  The northern one is
done all in silver and the southern on in gold.  Two huge columns flank
either side of the doors.  On the lintel above the columns a crown is
carved.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock
door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

380.name: In an ancient hallway.
desc: "   You walk down a slimy hallway.  Phosphorescent growths cling to the
walls providing a little illumination.  They do however make the hall
very slippery and you have to pick your way through them very carefully.

381.name: In an ancient hallway.
desc: "   The hallway makes a turn to the north, and the floor starts to slope down.
You get a faint whiff of fresh water, a pleasant change from the smell of
stale air to the east.

382.name: Near a cave in.
desc: "   The floor here tilts to the side and down, as though some huge force
had warped it.  Stones have fallen to the floor and you have to pick your
way over them.  The hallway to the north has collapsed and it looks like
you might not be able to get through.

383.name: Crawling through the rubble.
desc: "   You wiggle through the collapsed hall on your belly.  The hall once went
to the south and north, but the northern end is totally impassable.  The
floor is cracked in places and as you wriggle over one spot you see one crack
goes all the way down to the next level.

384.name: Queen's bedroom.
desc: "  An enormous bed dominates the room.  It once had a canopy but it was torn
off and tossed in one corner.  A pile of shredded pillows and blankets
lie on the bed.  It looks as though some creature has made a nest out of it.

385.name: Queen's chambers.
desc: "   The queen's chambers have been lined in silver.  A huge mirror once
reflected into the room but now it is smashed on the floor and its frame
gone.  The drawers of the vanity have been taken out and broken, and one
leg has been torn off.  A beautiful couch once graced the northern wall
but its pillows have been shredded.  Now it is just a skeleton of what it
once was.  There is a large bedroom off to the west.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

386.name: Prince's bedroom.
desc: "   You sqeeze through the hole at the bottom of the door.  The chill water on
the stone floor seeps through to your legs and knees making you shiver with
cold.  You stand up and shake the water off.  The room has three pieces of
furniture, a four poster bed, a dresser and a desk.  You laugh as you take in
the picture of them.  Each piece is very ornately carved.  Though you get the
idea that this is a man's room from the dark blues and deep wood stains, the
furnature is decorated in frills and bows.  The bedspread is covered in small
silk bows and lined with lace.

387.name: Princess's bedroom.
desc: "   You stand in a large bedroom.  The floor here stands a little higher than
the hall.  This has kept the floor much drier and the contents of the room
have stayed mostly intact.  Against the northern wall of the room stands a
huge canopied bed.  Its musty rose colored covers rain dust on the floor as
you touch them.  A dresser stands on the western wall.  You try to tug open
one of the drawers but it is warped shut.  On the eastern wall stands a
vanity with an enourmous mirror hanging over it.  Small vials of liquid have
been smashed over the top.  A large silver brush rests amid the mess.

388.name: Guardroom.
desc: "   A large spiderweb covers the entrance to the alcove.  You look at it in
disgust before you push your way through.  Inside seems to be a small guard
room.  It is set up to have a good view of the people coming up the stairs.
A few old spearheads rust on the floor, totally useless now.

389.name: Guardroom.
desc: "   This guard room looks over the stairway.  Whoever once sat here got a
good view of anyone coming up.  The room seems plain and unadorned.  There
was nothing here to keep the guards from being distracted from their duty.

390.name: Prince's bedroom.
desc: "   You walk through puddles of water to the middle of the room.  A huge four
poster bed is covered in a plain blue quilt.  The bed itself is very unadorned.
In fact the wood of all the furniture, the bed, the dresser and a desk, is
made of plain dark stained wood.  There is no ornamentation on any of it.

391.name: Crown prince's bedroom.
desc: "   You crawl through the hole on your hands and knees.  A bit of your armor
catches on the door and you struggle free.  You stand up in what was once
a spectacular bedroom.  All the furniture is tasteful yet beautiful.  A
parchment on the desk catches your eye.  You wipe away the cobwebs to read
it, but the parchment crumbles to dust at your touch.

392.name: King's suite.
desc: "   This is where the king once had his private office.  Two huge desks face
the door.  One has been turned over and looted.  The other, all done up in
gold leaf, is still solid.  You wonder why it has survived while the other
didn't.  You go over to it and try to lift it.  Its weight is far beyond
your strength.  It must be made of solid gold.  There is a large bedroom to
the west.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

393.name: King's bedroom.
desc: "   A huge bed stands in the middle of the room.  It too is made of gold.
The large quilts hanging off the side are stiched in gold thread.  The
thought of all this gold boggles you.  The dwarven kingdom must have been
very wealthy before it fell.

394.name: ToursInc.
desc: "   A woman looks up from a piece of paper.  She smiles and says, "Come in. Come
in.  I have two tour packages available right now.  The one to the bayou is
rather popular.  It's much better than the one to the geyser.  The tour
leaves at 8 am sharp so dont be late.  And it's 1000 coins in cash."  She
then goes back to writing.

395.name: In an underwater hallway.
desc: "   You are in an underwater hallway that goes east-west.  The eastern portion
has collapsed into a pile of rubble.  You can make your way up the rubble to
a small hole in the ceiling, or follow the hall to the west.

396.name: Underwater hall.
desc: "   You are following an east-west hall.  There is a door here to the north.
The door is short, four and a half feet tall and unadorned.  It is made from
what looks like the same stone of the hallway.  The hinges look rusted with
time but when you give the door a pull, the hinges snap and fall through
the water to the floor.

397.name: Over a hole.
desc: "   The hallway goes to the east and west, but the western side has part of
its floor missing.  You try to swim across but there are currents over the hole
that push you back.  You can go to the east or climb down the hole.

398.name: Underwater mine.
desc: "   The eastern portion of the old dwaven mines has collapsed, but you can
follow the tunnel to the west.  The current of an underground river moves
to the south into what looks like natural limestone caverns.  However the
current seems to pick up there and if you go you will likely not get back.

399.name: Underwater mine.
desc: "   The underground river flows swiftly along the mining tunnel to the east.
Little bits of an old cart lay trapped behind some rocks.  An old pickaxe
lies abandoned on the floor, its handle rotted away from the water.

400.name: Underwater mine.
desc: "   You follow an old mine tunnel.  The current threatens to drag you eastward.
You see an old mining cart that is being dragged and slammed against a rock.
It splinters into many small pieces each of which are picked up by the river
and dragged farther on.

401.name: Underwater mine.
desc: "   The underground river has broken through an ancient dwarven mine.  The
current here flows swiftly to the east, down the dwaven mining tunnel.  To
the west the river runs through a naturally formed waterway.

402.name: Underwater river.
desc: "   You follow a natural tunnel made by an underground river.  The current
is swift an drags you to the south.  You grab the bottom of a large
stalagmite to keep yourself from drifting off.  There seems to be a huge
cavern above you.

403.name: Store room.
desc: "   The door to this room is short but wide, to accomodate the carts that
hauled goods around the tunnels.  Most of the carts have fallen apart but
one seems whole if a little fragile.  It has two large wheels in the middle
supporting a large crate on top.  Two handles come out the front for the
dwarves to pull with.

404.name: Limestone caverns.
desc: "   You gasp in wonder as you break the surface of the water.  The huge
cavern is filled with a large mass of stalagmites growing from the floor.
As you look up you see strangely formed stalagtites drip from the cavern
roof.  One set catches your eye.  There is a stalagmite and stalagtite almost
touching.  There is a small water drip bridging the gap between the two.
You see a yellow-green glow coming from the walls.  It is made by a small
fungus growing on the limestone walls.

405.name: Magical vortex
desc: "   You feel the power of magic swirling around you.  The wounds of the
Earth Goddess leak the power of the earth directly to this spot.  Such
power is not meant to be felt by a mortal.  It twists your body in knots
and turns you inside out.  Pain courses through you and you are not sure
you can stand much more.

406.name: Caught in a magical vortex.
desc: "   The power of the earth was not meant for mere mortals.  It takes you up
and transforms to you pure energy.  The pain you felt earlier fades away
as your body changes.  You can no longer feel your hands or feet.  They are
gone, taken away in a swirl of light.  As your head starts to metamorphose
you loose your sense of sight.  You no longer see but you can sense the
flow of magic now.  It has a feel or is it a taste that you have no words
to describe.  You feel the lines of power and sense two lines pulling you
towards the east and west.

407.name: Carried by the wind.
desc: "   The wind picks you up and carries you west.  You try desperately to fight
against it but it is too strong.  You are whisked away towards a dark and
dismal lair.

408.name: Path to the swamps.
desc: "  The large cobbled path continues to the east and west.  You can make out the
swamp to the east, but worse you can smell it.  The stench smells disgusting,
compared to the clean air of the woods.

409.name: Path to the swamps.
desc: "   The path takes a bend to the north and east.  Someone seems to have paved
this part of the path in stone.  The cobbles of the path are even and well
laid.  They make walking here a pleasure.

410.name: Path to the swamps.
desc: "   The path continues to the north and south.  A small cart is stuck in the
mud.  Its wheels must have fallen off one of the rocks.  A peddler is trying
to lever the wheel out of the mud.  He notices you and says, "Well don't just
stand there help me get this free.

411.name: Path to the swamps.
desc: "   The large path becomes narrower to the south.  There it is only six feet
wide, just barely wide enough to handle the carts traveling through.  The soft
fertlie earth starts to become mud.  Here and there, where the puddles have
taken over the path, large rocks have been carefully placed.

412.name: Path to the swamps.
desc: "   You follow a large path through the woods.  You see the imprint of many
feet inbeded deep withing the soil, soil which is getting softer and softer
farther to the south.

413.name: Path near the road.
desc: "   A large path goes south from the Old Trade Road.  It is in fact a small
road of its own, being eight feet wide.  Wheel ruts go deep into the soft
earth.  Grass grows vigorously between the two ruts.  A wooden sign has been
pounded into the ground.
|        Swamps        |
|          of          |
|        Amnos         |
|  South three miles.  |
